Column Comment.0: SOFTWARE APPLICATION IDENTIFIER: Unique name or code for the softwareapplication.
Column Comment.1: SOFTWARE APPLICATION FUNCTION: A list of valid functions that a softwareapplication may have. Includes word processing, calculations, geologic interpretation,accounting, production accounting etc.
Column Comment.2: SOFTWARE APPLICATION FUNCTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A uniquesequencer allowing a software to have the same function over time (transitions in andout of use).
Column Comment.3: ABBREVIATION: Abbreviation used for reference type or code.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: LONG NAME: Common long name given to reference type or code.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.9: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.10: SHORT NAME: Common short name given to reference type or code.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.12: SOFTWARE APPLICATION FUNCTION TYPE: the kind of function of the software,such as geological interpretation, seismic processing, word processing etc.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: PPDM ROW QUALILTY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
